hm2DiagnosticMib.name: hm2DiagnosticMib
hm2DiagnosticMib.contactinfo: Postal: Stuttgarter Str. 45-51 72654 Neckartenzlingen Germany Phone: +49 7127 140 E-mail: hac.support@belden.com
hm2DiagnosticMib.description: Hirschmann Diagnostic MIB. Copyright (C) 2012. All Rights Reserved.

hm2DiagSelftestRAM.name: hm2DiagSelftestRAM
hm2DiagSelftestRAM.description: Controls RAM self-test on cold start of the device. When disabled the device booting time is reduced.

hm2DiagSelftestBootTime.name: hm2DiagSelftestBootTime
hm2DiagSelftestBootTime.description: Internal boot time in Milliseconds until activating ports.

hm2DiagSelftestActionCause.name: hm2DiagSelftestActionCause
hm2DiagSelftestActionCause.description: The area of the cause for the action the self-test wants to take.

hm2DiagSelftestAction.name: hm2DiagSelftestAction
hm2DiagSelftestAction.description: The action that the self-test component should take. The cause is always logged to the system log, additionally a trap can be sent to the management station or a reboot can be performed.

hm2BootSystemMonitor.name: hm2BootSystemMonitor
hm2BootSystemMonitor.description: Enable or disable the System Monitor access during the boot phase. Please note: If the System Monitor is disabled, it is possible to lose access to the device permanently in case of loosing administrator password or misconfiguration.

hm2BootDefaultConfigOnError.name: hm2BootDefaultConfigOnError
hm2BootDefaultConfigOnError.description: Enable or disable loading of the default configuration in case there is any error loading the configuration during the boot phase. If disabled the system will be halted.

hm2BootConfigPushButton.name: hm2BootConfigPushButton
hm2BootConfigPushButton.description: Enable or disable the push button functionality on the device.

hm2SigConCommonTable.name: hm2SigConCommonTable
hm2SigConCommonTable.description: This table contains all variables to configure the behavior of the signalling contacts.

hm2SigConID.name: hm2SigConID
hm2SigConID.description: This index is used to identify the associated signalling contact.

hm2SigConTrapEnable.name: hm2SigConTrapEnable
hm2SigConTrapEnable.description: Determines whether a trap shall be sent or not, when the signal contact operating state changes.

hm2SigConTrapCause.name: hm2SigConTrapCause
hm2SigConTrapCause.description: This object identifies the cause for a trap. The index of the entity which produces the trap is specified by hm2SigConTrapCauseIndex.

hm2SigConTrapCauseIndex.name: hm2SigConTrapCauseIndex
hm2SigConTrapCauseIndex.description: This attribute specifies the entity which produces the trap. power-supply: index of power-supply table link-failure: index of interface table temperature: 0 ext-nvm-removal: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) ext-nvm-not-in-sync: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) ring-redundancy: (1) MRP, (2) PRP, (3) HSR, (4) DLR ext-nvm-update-enabled: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) no-link: index of interface table 0: other errors

hm2SigConMode.name: hm2SigConMode
hm2SigConMode.description: This attribute specifies the behavior of the relay contact. The factory settings for signal contact 1 is monitoring the correct operation of entries specified to be survived. When the device has also a second signal contact, the factory setting for it is the manual mode.

hm2SigConOperState.name: hm2SigConOperState
hm2SigConOperState.description: This attribute shows the current operating state of the signal contact.

hm2SigConOperTimeStamp.name: hm2SigConOperTimeStamp
hm2SigConOperTimeStamp.description: This attribute shows local system time (hm2SystemLocalTime) of the last hm2SigConOperState change.

hm2SigConManualActivate.name: hm2SigConManualActivate
hm2SigConManualActivate.description: When operating in manual mode, the signal contact state can be set by this attribute.

hm2SigConSenseLinkFailure.name: hm2SigConSenseLinkFailure
hm2SigConSenseLinkFailure.description: Sets the monitoring of the network connection(s).

hm2SigConSenseTemperature.name: hm2SigConSenseTemperature
hm2SigConSenseTemperature.description: Sets the monitoring of the device temperature.

hm2SigConSenseFan.name: hm2SigConSenseFan
hm2SigConSenseFan.description: Sets the monitoring of the device fan. (currently not supported)

hm2SigConSenseModuleRemoval.name: hm2SigConSenseModuleRemoval
hm2SigConSenseModuleRemoval.description: Sets the monitoring of module removal (platform dependant).

hm2SigConSenseExtNvmRemoval.name: hm2SigConSenseExtNvmRemoval
hm2SigConSenseExtNvmRemoval.description: Sets the monitoring of the external non-volatile memory removal.

hm2SigConSenseExtNvmNotInSync.name: hm2SigConSenseExtNvmNotInSync
hm2SigConSenseExtNvmNotInSync.description: Sets the monitoring whether the external non-volatile memory is in sync with the configuration in NVRAM.

hm2SigConSenseRingRedundancy.name: hm2SigConSenseRingRedundancy
hm2SigConSenseRingRedundancy.description: Sets the monitoring of the ring redundancy.

hm2SigConPSTable.name: hm2SigConPSTable
hm2SigConPSTable.description: This table contains the configuration of all power supply states.

hm2SigConSensePSState.name: hm2SigConSensePSState
hm2SigConSensePSState.description: Sets the monitoring of the power supply state.

hm2SigConInterfaceTable.name: hm2SigConInterfaceTable
hm2SigConInterfaceTable.description: This table contains all variables to mask an alarm for the signalling relay, produced by a link. The index for a link corresponds with ifIndex. The table is also used for the device monitoring configuration.

hm2SigConSenseIfLinkAlarm.name: hm2SigConSenseIfLinkAlarm
hm2SigConSenseIfLinkAlarm.description: Indicates whether an alarm for the signalling relay of the associated link will be produced or not, so you can mask the value of ifMauMediaAvailable.

hm2SigConModuleTable.name: hm2SigConModuleTable
hm2SigConModuleTable.description: This table contains all variables to mask a module for the signaling relay. The index for a module corresponds with the slot number.

hm2SigConModID.name: hm2SigConModID
hm2SigConModID.description: This index is used to identify the associated module.

hm2SigConSenseModule.name: hm2SigConSenseModule
hm2SigConSenseModule.description: Indicates whether an alarm for the signalling relay of the associated module will be produced or not.

hm2SigConStatusTable.name: hm2SigConStatusTable
hm2SigConStatusTable.description: This table shows the current monitored entities for which there is a trap cause (hm2SigConTrapCause) active.

hm2SigConStatusIndex.name: hm2SigConStatusIndex
hm2SigConStatusIndex.description: This index is used to identify the occured event.

hm2SigConStatusTimeStamp.name: hm2SigConStatusTimeStamp
hm2SigConStatusTimeStamp.description: This attribute shows the local system time (hm2SystemLocalTime) of occuration the event.

hm2SigConStatusTrapCause.name: hm2SigConStatusTrapCause
hm2SigConStatusTrapCause.description: This object identifies the cause for a trap. The index of the entity which produces the trap is specified by hm2SigConTrapCauseIndex.

hm2SigConStatusTrapCauseIndex.name: hm2SigConStatusTrapCauseIndex
hm2SigConStatusTrapCauseIndex.description: This attribute specifies the entity which produces the trap. power-supply: index of power-supply table link-failure: index of interface table temperature: 0 ext-nvm-removal: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) ext-nvm-not-in-sync: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) ring-redundancy: (1) MRP, (2) PRP, (3) HSR, (4) DLR ext-nvm-update-enabled: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) no-link: index of interface table 0: other errors

hm2DevMonCommonTable.name: hm2DevMonCommonTable
hm2DevMonCommonTable.description: This table contains all variables to configure the behavior of the signalling contacts.

hm2DevMonID.name: hm2DevMonID
hm2DevMonID.description: This index is used to identify the associated device monitoring group. Currently only one group is supported

hm2DevMonTrapEnable.name: hm2DevMonTrapEnable
hm2DevMonTrapEnable.description: Determines whether a trap shall be sent or not when the signal contact operating state changes.

hm2DevMonTrapCause.name: hm2DevMonTrapCause
hm2DevMonTrapCause.description: This object identifies the cause for a trap. The index of the entity which produces the trap is specified by hm2DevMonTrapCauseIndex.

hm2DevMonTrapCauseIndex.name: hm2DevMonTrapCauseIndex
hm2DevMonTrapCauseIndex.description: This attribute specifies the entity which produces the trap. power-supply: index of power supply table link-failure: index of interface table temperature: 0 ext-nvm-removal: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) Serial (not supported yet) ext-nvm-not-in-sync: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) Serial (not supported yet) ring-redundancy: (1) MRP, (2) PRP, (3), HSR, (4) DLR 0: other errors

hm2DevMonOperState.name: hm2DevMonOperState
hm2DevMonOperState.description: This attribute shows the current operating state of the signal contact.

hm2DevMonOperTimeStamp.name: hm2DevMonOperTimeStamp
hm2DevMonOperTimeStamp.description: This attribute shows the local system time (hm2SystemLocalTime) of the last hm2DevMonOperState change.

hm2DevMonSenseLinkFailure.name: hm2DevMonSenseLinkFailure
hm2DevMonSenseLinkFailure.description: Sets the monitoring of the network connection(s).

hm2DevMonSenseTemperature.name: hm2DevMonSenseTemperature
hm2DevMonSenseTemperature.description: Sets the monitoring of the device temperature.

hm2DevMonSenseFan.name: hm2DevMonSenseFan
hm2DevMonSenseFan.description: Sets the monitoring of the device fan. (currently not supported)

hm2DevMonSenseModuleRemoval.name: hm2DevMonSenseModuleRemoval
hm2DevMonSenseModuleRemoval.description: Sets the monitoring of module removal (platform dependent).

hm2DevMonSenseExtNvmRemoval.name: hm2DevMonSenseExtNvmRemoval
hm2DevMonSenseExtNvmRemoval.description: Sets the monitoring of the external non-volatile memory removal.

hm2DevMonSenseExtNvmNotInSync.name: hm2DevMonSenseExtNvmNotInSync
hm2DevMonSenseExtNvmNotInSync.description: Sets the monitoring whether the external non-volatile memory is in sync with the configuration in NVRAM.

hm2DevMonSenseRingRedundancy.name: hm2DevMonSenseRingRedundancy
hm2DevMonSenseRingRedundancy.description: Sets the monitoring of the ring redundancy.

hm2DevMonPSTable.name: hm2DevMonPSTable
hm2DevMonPSTable.description: This table contains the configuration of all power supply states.

hm2DevMonSensePSState.name: hm2DevMonSensePSState
hm2DevMonSensePSState.description: Sets the monitoring of the power supply state.

hm2DevMonInterfaceTable.name: hm2DevMonInterfaceTable
hm2DevMonInterfaceTable.description: This table contains all variables to mask an alarm for the signalling relay, produced by a link. The index for a link corresponds with ifIndex. The table is also used for the device monitoring configuration.

hm2DevMonSenseIfLinkAlarm.name: hm2DevMonSenseIfLinkAlarm
hm2DevMonSenseIfLinkAlarm.description: Indicates whether an alarm for the signalling relay of the associated link will be produced or not, so you can mask the value of ifMauMediaAvailable.

hm2DevMonModuleTable.name: hm2DevMonModuleTable
hm2DevMonModuleTable.description: This table contains all variables to mask a module for the device status. The index for a module corresponds with the slot number.

hm2DevMonModID.name: hm2DevMonModID
hm2DevMonModID.description: This index is used to identify the associated module.

hm2DevMonSenseModule.name: hm2DevMonSenseModule
hm2DevMonSenseModule.description: Indicates whether an alarm for the device status of the associated module will be produced or not.

hm2DevMonStatusTable.name: hm2DevMonStatusTable
hm2DevMonStatusTable.description: This table shows the current monitored entities in the hm2DeviceMonitorGroup for which there is a trap cause (hm2DevMonStatusTrapCause) active.

hm2DevMonStatusIndex.name: hm2DevMonStatusIndex
hm2DevMonStatusIndex.description: This index is used to identify the occured event.

hm2DevMonStatusTimeStamp.name: hm2DevMonStatusTimeStamp
hm2DevMonStatusTimeStamp.description: This attribute shows the local system time (hm2SystemLocalTime) of occuration the event.

hm2DevMonStatusTrapCause.name: hm2DevMonStatusTrapCause
hm2DevMonStatusTrapCause.description: This object identifies the cause for a trap. The index of the entity which produces the trap is specified by hm2DevMonTrapCauseIndex.

hm2DevMonStatusTrapCauseIndex.name: hm2DevMonStatusTrapCauseIndex
hm2DevMonStatusTrapCauseIndex.description: This attribute specifies the entity which produces the trap. power-supply: index of power supply table link-failure: index of interface table temperature: 0 ext-nvm-removal: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) Serial (not supported yet) ext-nvm-not-in-sync: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) Serial (not supported yet) ring-redundancy: (1) MRP, (2) PRP, (3) HSR, (4) DLR 0: other errors

hm2DevSecTrapEnable.name: hm2DevSecTrapEnable
hm2DevSecTrapEnable.description: Determines whether a trap shall be sent or not, when the device security operating state changes.

hm2DevSecTrapCause.name: hm2DevSecTrapCause
hm2DevSecTrapCause.description: This object identifies the cause for a trap. The index of the entity which produces the trap is specified by hm2DevMonTrapCauseIndex.

hm2DevSecTrapCauseIndex.name: hm2DevSecTrapCauseIndex
hm2DevSecTrapCauseIndex.description: This attribute specifies the entity which produces the trap. ext-nvm-update-enabled: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) no-link: index of interface table 0: other errors.

hm2DevSecOperState.name: hm2DevSecOperState
hm2DevSecOperState.description: This attribute shows the current operating state of the signal contact.

hm2DevSecOperTimeStamp.name: hm2DevSecOperTimeStamp
hm2DevSecOperTimeStamp.description: This attribute shows the local system time (hm2SystemLocalTime) of the last hm2DevSecOperState change.

hm2DevSecSensePasswordChange.name: hm2DevSecSensePasswordChange
hm2DevSecSensePasswordChange.description: Enable or disable to check if default passwords for 'user' and 'admin' are not changed.

hm2DevSecSensePasswordMinLength.name: hm2DevSecSensePasswordMinLength
hm2DevSecSensePasswordMinLength.description: Enable or disable to check if configured minimum password length is < 8 characters.

hm2DevSecSensePasswordStrengthNotConfigu.name: hm2DevSecSensePasswordStrengthNotConfigured
hm2DevSecSensePasswordStrengthNotConfigu.description: Enable or disable minimum password strength to check if (1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 number, 1 non-alphanumeric) is not configured.

hm2DevSecSenseBypassPasswordStrength.name: hm2DevSecSenseBypassPasswordStrength
hm2DevSecSenseBypassPasswordStrength.description: Enable or disable to check if at least one user is configured to bypass strength check.

hm2DevSecSenseTelnetEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseTelnetEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseTelnetEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if telnet is enabled on the switch.

hm2DevSecSenseHttpEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseHttpEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseHttpEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if HTTP is enabled on the switch.

hm2DevSecSenseSnmpUnsecure.name: hm2DevSecSenseSnmpUnsecure
hm2DevSecSenseSnmpUnsecure.description: Enable or disable to check if SNMP v1/v2 is enabled or v3 encryption is disabled.

hm2DevSecSenseSysmonEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseSysmonEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseSysmonEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if sysmon1 access is not disabled.

hm2DevSecSenseExtNvmUpdateEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseExtNvmUpdateEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseExtNvmUpdateEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if external non-volatile memory update is not disabled.

hm2DevSecSenseNoLinkEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseNoLinkEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseNoLinkEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if at least one port has no link but admin state is up.

hm2DevSecSenseHiDiscoveryEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseHiDiscoveryEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseHiDiscoveryEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if HiDiscovery is enabled and the mode is 'read-write'.

hm2DevSecSenseExtNvmConfigLoadUnsecure.name: hm2DevSecSenseExtNvmConfigLoadUnsecure
hm2DevSecSenseExtNvmConfigLoadUnsecure.description: Enable or disable to check if the configuration load from external NVM is unsecure. (The configuration priority of the external NVM is set to 'first', 'second' or 'third' and the configuration encryption is not active.)

hm2DevSecSenseIec61850MmsEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseIec61850MmsEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseIec61850MmsEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if IEC 61850 MMS is enabled on the switch.

hm2DevSecSenseHttpsCertificateWarning.name: hm2DevSecSenseHttpsCertificateWarning
hm2DevSecSenseHttpsCertificateWarning.description: Enable or disable to check for the presence of the auto generated self-signed HTTPS certificate.

hm2DevSecSenseModbusTcpEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseModbusTcpEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseModbusTcpEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if Modbus/TCP server is enabled on the switch.

hm2DevSecSenseEtherNetIpEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseEtherNetIpEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseEtherNetIpEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if EtherNet/IP protocol is enabled on the switch.

hm2DevSecSenseProfinetIOEnabled.name: hm2DevSecSenseProfinetIOEnabled
hm2DevSecSenseProfinetIOEnabled.description: Enable or disable to check if ProfinetIO protocol is enabled on the switch.

hm2DevSecInterfaceTable.name: hm2DevSecInterfaceTable
hm2DevSecInterfaceTable.description: This table contains all variables to mask an alarm for the signalling relay, produced by a link. The index for a link corresponds with ifIndex. The table is also used for the device monitoring configuration.

hm2DevSecSenseIfNoLink.name: hm2DevSecSenseIfNoLink
hm2DevSecSenseIfNoLink.description: Port has no link but admin state is up

hm2DevSecStatusTable.name: hm2DevSecStatusTable
hm2DevSecStatusTable.description: This table shows the current monitored entities in the hm2DevSecConfigGroup for which there is a trap cause (hm2DevSecStatusTrapCause) active.

hm2DevSecStatusIndex.name: hm2DevSecStatusIndex
hm2DevSecStatusIndex.description: This index is used to identify the occured event.

hm2DevSecStatusTimeStamp.name: hm2DevSecStatusTimeStamp
hm2DevSecStatusTimeStamp.description: This attribute shows the local system time (hm2SystemLocalTime) of occuration the event.

hm2DevSecStatusTrapCause.name: hm2DevSecStatusTrapCause
hm2DevSecStatusTrapCause.description: This object identifies the cause for a trap. The index of the entity which produces the trap is specified by hm2DevSecTrapCauseIndex.

hm2DevSecStatusTrapCauseIndex.name: hm2DevSecStatusTrapCauseIndex
hm2DevSecStatusTrapCauseIndex.description: This attribute specifies the entity which produces the trap. ext-nvm-update-enabled: (1) sd, (2) usb, (3) serial (not supported yet) no-link: index of interface table 0: other errors.

hm2LedPortMode.name: hm2LedPortMode
hm2LedPortMode.description: Switch LED signalling between the port LEDs on front side (port panel) and the port LEDs on the back side (service panel) of the device.

hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationTable.name: hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationTable
hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationTable.description: This table contains variables for each interface of the switch.

hm2DiagIfaceUtilization.name: hm2DiagIfaceUtilization
hm2DiagIfaceUtilization.description: The best estimate of the mean physical layer network utilization on this interface during the last sampling interval, in hundredth of one percent. The first historyControlInterval (rfc1757) of this interface is used as sampling interval.

hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationControlInterval.name: hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationControlInterval
hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationControlInterval.description: The interval in seconds over which the data is sampled for hmIfaceUtilization. This interval can be any number of seconds between 1 and 3600 (1 hour). The first historyControlInterval (rfc1757) of this interface is used as sampling interval.

hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmLowerThresho.name: hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmLowerThreshold
hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmLowerThresho.description: Surveys the interface utilization hm2InfaceUtilization and generates an alarm for this interfaces, if the utilization value is below the given limit. A value of 0 disables the alarm generation.

hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmUpperThresho.name: hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmUpperThreshold
hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmUpperThresho.description: Surveys the interface utilization hm2DiagIfaceUtilization and generates an alarm for this interfaces, if the given limit is exceeded. A value of 0 disables the alarm generation.

hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmCondition.name: hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmCondition
hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmCondition.description: The alarm condition is given (true), if the given hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmUpperThreshold limit is exceeded by the interface utilization or if the utilization value falls below hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmLowerThreshold limit. The alarm condition will be removed, when the interface utilization value falls in between hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmLowerThreshold hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationAlarmUpperThreshold.

hm2DiagCableTesterStatus.name: hm2DiagCableTesterStatus
hm2DiagCableTesterStatus.description: Status of the Virtual Cable Tester active(1) - Cable testing is in progress. Set to this value to start the test. success(2) - A successful test was performed. Cannot be set. failure(3) - A failure was encountered during the test. Cannot be set. uninitialized(4) - No test has been performed yet. Cannot be set.

hm2DiagCableTesterIfIndex.name: hm2DiagCableTesterIfIndex
hm2DiagCableTesterIfIndex.description: Determines on which port to perform the cable test. Limited to copper based ports.

hm2DiagCableTesterCableTable.name: hm2DiagCableTesterCableTable
hm2DiagCableTesterCableTable.description: This table contains variables for each pair of the cable.

hm2DiagCableTesterCablePair.name: hm2DiagCableTesterCablePair
hm2DiagCableTesterCablePair.description: Index of the hm2DiagCableTesterCableTable. If a PHY does not support the measurement per pair, the first index is used to show the values.

hm2DiagCableTesterCableStatus.name: hm2DiagCableTesterCableStatus
hm2DiagCableTesterCableStatus.description: Indicates the results of the Cable Test. normal(1) - The cable is working correctly. open(2) - The cable is disconnected or there is a faulty connector. short(3) - There is an electrical short in the cable. unknown(4) - No test has been performed yet, or a test is currently in progress.

hm2DiagCableTesterCableMinimumLength.name: hm2DiagCableTesterCableMinimumLength
hm2DiagCableTesterCableMinimumLength.description: The estimated length of the cable in meters. This value indicates the shortest length estimated. This object will return 0 if hm2DiagCableTesterStatus is not success(2) or the cable length is unknown.

hm2DiagCableTesterCableMaximumLength.name: hm2DiagCableTesterCableMaximumLength
hm2DiagCableTesterCableMaximumLength.description: The estimated length of the cable in meters. This value indicates the longest length estimated. This object will return 0 if hm2DiagCableTesterStatus is not success(2) or the cable length is unknown.

hm2DiagCableTesterCableFailureLocation.name: hm2DiagCableTesterCableFailureLocation
hm2DiagCableTesterCableFailureLocation.description: The estimated distance in meters from the end of the cable to the failure location. This object will return 0 if hm2DiagCableTesterStatus is not success(2).

hm2PortMonitorAdminMode.name: hm2PortMonitorAdminMode
hm2PortMonitorAdminMode.description: Global switch to enable / disable the port state actions, which are performed if a condition becomes true

hm2KbpsUnitTrafficTypeInvalid.name: hm2KbpsUnitTrafficTypeInvalid
hm2KbpsUnitTrafficTypeInvalid.description: Interface {0}: 'Kbps' unit can only be used for traffic type 'all'.

hm2PortMonitorConditionSpeedDuplexMode.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionSpeedDuplexMode
hm2PortMonitorConditionSpeedDuplexMode.description: Interface Speed and Duplex monitor mode.

hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapIntfTable.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapIntfTable
hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapIntfTable.description: Port condition link flap interface table.

hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapIntfEntry.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapIntfEntry
hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapIntfEntry.description: Port condition link flap interface entry.

hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapInterval.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapInterval
hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapInterval.description: Measure interval in seconds (1-180s) for link flap detection.

hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapCountInte.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapCountInterval
hm2PortMonitorConditionLinkFlapCountInte.description: Link flap count that occured in last interval.

hm2PortMonitorConditionCrcFragmentsInter.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionCrcFragmentsInterval
hm2PortMonitorConditionCrcFragmentsInter.description: Measure interval in seconds (5-180s) for CrcFragments detection.

hm2PortMonitorConditionCrcFragmentsCount.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionCrcFragmentsCountInterval
hm2PortMonitorConditionCrcFragmentsCount.description: CrcFragments count that occured in last interval.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntfTable.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntfTable
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntfTable.description: Port condition overload detection interface table.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntfEntry.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntfEntry
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntfEntry.description: Port condition overload detection interface entry.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetLwrTholdVa.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetLwrTholdVal
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetLwrTholdVa.description: Overload detection condition lower threshold value.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetUprTholdVa.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetUprTholdVal
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetUprTholdVa.description: Overload detection condition upper threshold value.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntvl.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntvl
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetIntvl.description: Measure interval in seconds (1-20s) for overload detection.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntAll.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntAll
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntAll.description: All package count from last interval.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntBC.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntBC
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntBC.description: Broadcast package count from last interval.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntMC.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntMC
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntMC.description: Overload detection condition lower threshold value.

hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntKbit.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntKbit
hm2PortMonitorConditionOvldDetPkgCntKbit.description: Overload detection condition lower threshold value.

hm2PortMonitorConditionSpeedDuplexValue.name: hm2PortMonitorConditionSpeedDuplexValue
hm2PortMonitorConditionSpeedDuplexValue.description: Speed and duplex combination allowed by port-monitor.

hm2DiagEnableMeasurement.name: hm2DiagEnableMeasurement
hm2DiagEnableMeasurement.description: Enable or disable the resources measurement If disabled, the task - needed for measurement - is also deleted.

hm2DiagCpuUtilization.name: hm2DiagCpuUtilization
hm2DiagCpuUtilization.description: The current cpu utilization of the device in percent.

hm2DiagCpuAverageUtilization.name: hm2DiagCpuAverageUtilization
hm2DiagCpuAverageUtilization.description: The average cpu utilization of the device in percent, max. measured over the last 30 minutes.

hm2DiagCpuRunningProcesses.name: hm2DiagCpuRunningProcesses
hm2DiagCpuRunningProcesses.description: The current number of processes running.

hm2DiagCpuMaxRunningProcesses.name: hm2DiagCpuMaxRunningProcesses
hm2DiagCpuMaxRunningProcesses.description: The maximum number of processes running, max. since the last 30 minutes.

hm2DiagMemoryRamAllocated.description: The current allocated RAM of the device in kBytes.

hm2DiagMemoryRamFree.name: hm2DiagMemoryRamFree
hm2DiagMemoryRamFree.description: The current free RAM of the device in kBytes.

hm2DiagMemoryRamAllocatedAverage.name: hm2DiagMemoryRamAllocatedAverage
hm2DiagMemoryRamAllocatedAverage.description: The average allocated RAM of the device in kBytes, measured over the last 30 minutes.

hm2DiagMemoryRamFreeAverage.name: hm2DiagMemoryRamFreeAverage
hm2DiagMemoryRamFreeAverage.description: The average free RAM of the device in kBytes, measured over the last 30 minutes.

hm2DiagMemoryRawFlashMainAllocated.name: hm2DiagMemoryRawFlashMainAllocated
hm2DiagMemoryRawFlashMainAllocated.description: The current allocated flash memory for the main software image in kBytes.

hm2DiagMemoryRawFlashMainFree.name: hm2DiagMemoryRawFlashMainFree
hm2DiagMemoryRawFlashMainFree.description: The current free flash memory for the main software image in kBytes.

hm2DiagMemoryFlashFileSystemAllocated.name: hm2DiagMemoryFlashFileSystemAllocated
hm2DiagMemoryFlashFileSystemAllocated.description: The current allocated memory within the flash file system in kBytes.

hm2DiagMemoryFlashFileSystemFree.name: hm2DiagMemoryFlashFileSystemFree
hm2DiagMemoryFlashFileSystemFree.description: The current free memory within the flash file system in kBytes.

hm2DiagNetworkCpuIfUtilization.name: hm2DiagNetworkCpuIfUtilization
hm2DiagNetworkCpuIfUtilization.description: The current network utilization of the internal cpu interface in percent.

hm2DiagNetworkCpuIfAverageUtilization.description: The average network utilization of the internal cpu interface in percent, measured over the last 30 minutes.

hm2SigConStateChangeTrap.description: This trap is sent if the value of hm2SigConState changes its value.

hm2DevMonStateChangeTrap.description: This trap is sent if the value of hm2DevMonState changes its value.

hm2DevSecStateChangeTrap.description: This trap is sent if the value of hm2DevSecState changes its value.

hm2DiagSelftestActionTrap.name: hm2DiagSelftestActionTrap
hm2DiagSelftestActionTrap.description: This trap is sent if a self-test action is performed and hm2DiagSelftestAction is configured to sendTrap(2).

hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationTrap.name: hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationTrap
hm2DiagIfaceUtilizationTrap.description: This trap is sent if the value of hmIfaceUtilization exceeds or falls back below the interface utilization thresholds hmIfaceUtilizationAlarmConditionThreshold and hmIfaceUtilizationAlarmRemovalThreshold.

hm2PortMonitorPortTrap.name: hm2PortMonitorPortTrap
hm2PortMonitorPortTrap.description: This trap is sent if the a port has been disabled by port disable action by port monitor.
